channel.title: UB2030
channel.itunes:author: Universiteitsbibliotheek Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
channel.description: UB 2030 is een podcast over de innovatie van de universiteitsbibliotheek door technologische veranderingen en verschuivingen in onderzoek en onderwijs.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Research Data Management
item.itunes:author: Tim Pinchetti, Meron Vermaas, Marcel Ras
item.description: The podcast delves into the current state, challenges, and future directions of research data and software management, emphasizing their importance for the integrity, transparency, and efficiency of scientific research.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Research Intelligence
item.itunes:author: Matthijs de Zwaan, Rik Iping
item.description: This episode speculates about the ideal future of research intelligence in 2030, focusing on technological trends like AI and scientific network structures while addressing technological developments and historical challenges.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Open Science
item.itunes:author: Sander Bos, Ludo Waltman
item.description: Explores the significance of Open Science and envisions a future where science is accessible, inclusive, coordinated, and innovative.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Research Support
item.itunes:author: Joeri Both, Aaron Tay
item.description: Discusses the evolving role of libraries in supporting increasingly complex research environments, the need for technological expertise, and the library's transition to being expertise networks within universities.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Digital Services and Infrastructure
item.itunes:author: Alexey Pristupa, Alistair Dunning
item.description: Explores the future of digital library services and infrastructures, focusing on the Future's Triangle, definitions of key concepts, and the interaction between present pressures and future aspirations in library innovation.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Education Support
item.itunes:author: Cees van Gent, Rens van der Vorst
item.description: Discusses the importance of human-centered education, the evolving role of technology in education, and the challenges of redefining educational values and methods to promote personal development and authentic learning.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Special Collections
item.itunes:author: August den Hollander, Michiel Cock
item.description: Discusses the intersection of heritage and technology, the potential of digital collections, and the importance of inclusivity in preserving and presenting heritage, emphasizing both digital and physical experiences.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Information Services
item.itunes:author: Jan Struiksma
item.description: Explores the role of AI in education, focusing on its impact on research, learning, and teaching, while addressing challenges like accessibility, copyright, sustainability, and the evolving role of libraries in supporting open access and digital tools.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Bibliotheek als Plek
item.itunes:author: Aat Vos, Jan-Maarten Pauw
item.description: Examines the role of libraries as physical and digital meeting spaces, focusing on inclusivity, social interaction, and libraries as hubs for community engagement and knowledge sharing.

item.title: UB2030 - Toekomst van Bibliotheek in de Maatschappij
item.itunes:author: Frank Kupper, Hilde van Wijngaarden
item.description: Highlights the transformative role of libraries in fostering dialogue and knowledge sharing, emphasizing their evolution towards open information dissemination and social engagement in science communication.
